snippet: The Douglas Elliman brokerage reports that sales reached their highest level since 2007, citing fence sitters’ anticipation of higher mortgage rates.
abstract: Douglas Elliman brokerage reports Manhattan's residential home sales reached their highest level since 2007, citing fence sitters’ anticipation of higher mortgage rates; volume of sales increased by 30 percent over 2012,  while inventory was down by nearly 22 percent; bidding wars, popular with everyone except buyers, regained their toehold on negotiations, and sellers were able to reap 98 percent of their final asking price.
lead_paragraph: The Douglas Elliman brokerage reports that sales reached their highest level since 2007, citing fence sitters’ anticipation of higher mortgage rates.

headline.main: Home Sales Rose in Tighter Manhattan Market, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Home Sales Rose in Tighter Manhattan Market, Report Says
